posts.post_content:
Posted By: Eric
Anyone out there have a PSA 8 Old Judge N172 they want to sell?

Email me.

Posted By: Kevin Cummings
Eric:

Bruce Kasarda has an Old Judge Sage and Van Dyke PSA 8 two-player card I am sure he would be happy to sell to you.

The thread is near the bottom of the 19th Century BST page.

Kevin

Posted By: Bruce Kasarda
Kevin, isn't that Browning you have a PSA 8.

Posted By: bigfish
Kevin,

if Bruce passes on the Browning, please send me a scan.  He is on my wantlist.

tp7161@yahoo.com

Posted By: Eric
Yes... I've been talking to Bruce about his.....


Kevin... do you have one as Toby suggests?

Posted By: bigfish
Eric,

did you find one yet?  There is one on ebay.

Posted By: Eric
Yes.... I saw the one on ebay... I bid as well...

The reserve price is unrealistic

Posted By: Kevin Cummings
Gentlemen (you, too, Toby):

I am just too emotionally attached to my PSA 8 Browning (I found it in my grandfather's attic and he gave it to me on his deathbed - God bless him!) to sell it.

My PSA 8 Anson in uniform, however, could be had for the right price! [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]

Kevin

Posted By: bigfish
Kevin,

congrats on the find.  I would consider selling you my uncirculated Cap Anson N172 pose on a bearskin rug.  He appears to be holding a bat in his hands.  My dad found this in an old tackle box.  As always, all in good fun!!!

O'doyle Rules!!!!

Posted By: Fred C
Dang you guys found some neat stuff but I doubt that you can top my OJ of Hugh Ignacious Daily which was given to my grandfather who got it from the grand daughter of Bid McPhee who found it stuck in a wall in a house that was once a bordelo frequented by Wyatt Earp in down town San Diego.

That said, I might have it graded by SGC but their highest grade is only a 100 and this card would surely be off that scale.

Posted By: bigfish
I heard Kevin obtained that Cap Anson card he references above from Doc Holiday who won in a poker game in Tomstone.  The card was given to a local shoemaker named Dolly just before Doc passed away.  It is amazing the cards that Kevin finds.  Truly vintage!!

Posted By: john w
There is an SGC 88 in Goodwin's auction ending today

Posted By: Eric
Thanks John....

I don't think that card would cross to a PSA 8 however.

The back isn't clean, looks stained
